data.question: What is the space group of ZAG-4 according to DFT calculations at 0 pressure?
What is the volume change of ZAG-6 when pressure is increased from 0 to 6.9 GPa according to experimental data?
data.answer: The volume decreases from 1358.7(4) Å3 to 1004.4(4) Å3.

data.question: Does ZAG-4 exhibit negative linear compressibility?
What is the maximum Young's modulus (Emax) value for ZAG-6?
Is the density of ZAG-6 at 6.9 GPa higher than its density at ambient pressure?
What phenomenon is observed in ZAG-4 at a pressure of 3.8 GPa?
data.answer: A spontaneous proton jump is observed.

data.question: Does the linker chain in ZAG-6 coil under high pressure?
What is the minimum linear compressibility (βmin) value for ZAG-4?
Is the enthalpy of the coiled–H3O+ structure of ZAG-6 lower at higher pressures compared to the straight–H2O structure?
What is the role of interstitial water molecules in ZAG compounds?
data.answer: They form three hydrogen bonds, two to the framework and one from the framework.

data.question: Are the elastic properties of ZAG-4 and ZAG-6 calculated using quantum chemical calculations?
What is the maximum shear modulus (Gmax) for ZAG-4?
Does ZAG-6 undergo a pressure-induced proton transfer similar to ZAG-4?
What is the effect of pressure on the P–O bond distance in ZAG-6?
data.answer: The P–O bond distance shortens from 1.562(2) to 1.503(9) Å, indicating a pressure-induced proton jump.

data.question: Are the crystallographic data for ZAG-6 at ambient and high pressure provided in the Supporting Information?
What is the crystal system of ZAG-6 according to experimental data at 0 pressure?
Does the presence of a proton jump in ZAG-4 and ZAG-6 make them candidates for pressure-switchable proton conduction materials?
What is the role of the alkyl chain length in determining the flexibility of ZAG materials?
data.answer: The alkyl chain length affects the flexibility of ZAG materials, with longer chains like in ZAG-6 exhibiting coiling under pressure.

data.question: Are the mechanical properties of ZAG-4 and ZAG-6 derived from the elastic stiffness matrix?
What is the significance of the negative linear compressibility observed in ZAG-4 and ZAG-6?
data.answer: Negative linear compressibility is significant as it indicates the materials' unique response to pressure, potentially useful for applications requiring materials that expand under pressure.
